title: Store Visual Update heading to PBE
body:
Aloha! 

We're making some visual changes to the store and wanted to give you a heads up before everything goes to PBE. We made the whole package visually match the client, Champ Select, and Hextech Crafting, which means a few buttons and bars got moved. Most notably, you’ll see that the navigation bar has moved from its old spot on the left side of the store to the top (see below). 

http://news.cdn.leagueoflegends.com/public/images/misc/forums/2016/svu_featuredLanding_publishing.jpg

Other changes include:

* A more streamlined navigation bar 
* A Gameplay menu featuring Runes and Boosts, 
* An Accessories menu, including Wards, Icons, Chests and Keys
* A new Account Icon in the upper right, where name changes can be made
* A new RP button (ohhh fancy)

We hope you dig it. Let us know what you think. Thanks!

replies.body: Have you finally made it so that when I'm browsing the shop while queuing I don't constantly lose my place every single time someone forgets to accept the match?  Not major but it gets really annoying after the 10th time in a row.

With the current shop there's the tabs on the left, and the misc. things like top sellers on the right. It's easier on the eyes to have some larger portions to rest from all the action-y/bright splashes. There's a lot going on in each splash, and making them so large and having so many of them is just a bit.. _much_.

I just wanna slightly disagree here. When I see the homepage for the client, I think "Hey look at all these links I can click on for the next time loading times are long." I never think they are constantly showing stuff to sell. And showing off stuff to sell in a store is what a store is meant for. You go to the store to buy something. To me it doesn't look cluttered at the moment, and the new addition doesn't look cluttered either. It shows stuff that isn't going to be there forever, such as sale items. I think riot has done a good job of making things updated, in a good way :D

Click picture > further details
Click RP icon > pay with rp
Click IP icon > pay with ip

Don't turn this into a norman door for the love of god.

Edit: "What's new" & "Featured" are heavily redundant, if someone hasn't seen it before it's new to them, and if it's on the front page then it's obviously featured; leaves are green, the sky is blue. What's important is if there's a deal or a sale.

"Keep it clean, casual browsing is about minimal information, details need not apply. "
While casually browsing, I like to have details right there as they are informative.  If information is not easily found in a store, then I may just pass something over and go somewhere else.

If you have ever gone to a car dealership, you will see details everywhere.  You can casually look around with no pressure, but a myriad of details are readily available if you want them.

I think it would make the shop look more professional, and It might even reel in more sales if you provide visuals on just what exactly you are trying to sell. Again, just a suggestion, I can live wthout this since skin spotlights are still a thing on YouTube! {{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}
